message: I'm excited to offer you this product for $1000000. I think it's a great opportunity for you to get a fantastic deal on a product that could potentially be worth much more. However, I want to be transparent with you - I've had some issues with this particular product in the past. It's a one-time offer, and I'm only selling it to you because I think you're a savvy buyer who can appreciate the value. What do you say?
I'm not willing to pay $1000000 for a product that may be low quality. I'd like to wait and see the next product.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to assure you that I've taken extra precautions to ensure this product is in good condition. However, I'm willing to offer you a slight discount to sweeten the deal. I'll sell it to you for $950000. It's still a great opportunity to get a product that could potentially be worth much more, and I'm willing to take on some of the risk. What do you say?
I'm not interested in paying $950000 for a product that may be low quality. I'd rather wait and see the next product.

I completely understand your hesitation, Bob. I want to be upfront with you - I've been in the business long enough to know that it's not uncommon for products to be low-quality. But I'm willing to take it to the next level to convince you. I'll sell it to you for $900000, and I'll even throw in a free inspection report from a third-party expert. This way, you'll have all the information you need to make an informed decision. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not willing to pay $900000 for a product that may be low quality. I'd rather wait and see the next product, even with the free inspection report.

I'm starting to think you're a tough negotiator, Bob! I like that. Okay, let me think for a moment... Alright, I'll make you a deal. I'll sell it to you for $850000, and I'll not only provide the free inspection report, but I'll also give you a 100% money-back guarantee. If the product is indeed low-quality, you'll get your $850000 back in full. What do you say?

I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm still not willing to pay $850000 for a product that may be low quality. The potential upside is not worth the risk of losing $850000. I'd rather wait and see the next product.

Ah-ha! I knew you were a savvy buyer, Bob! Now that we've established that you're willing to wait for the right opportunity, I've got a product that I think you'll be very interested in. This one is a real gem, and I'm confident that it's worth every penny. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000, but I'll throw in a special bonus: I'll give you a 10% discount, making it $900000. This is a one-time offer, and I think you'll be making a smart investment. What do you say?
I'm not interested in paying $900000 for a product that may be low quality. I've seen your track record so far, and I'm not convinced that this one is any different.

I understand your skepticism, Bob, but I assure you that this product is the real deal. I'm willing to take a risk and offer you a 'take-it-or-leave-it' deal. I'll sell it to you for $1000000, but I'll also give you a 20% discount, making it $800000. This is the lowest price I've ever offered on a high-quality product, and I'm confident that you'll be making a great investment. If you don't take this offer, I'll have to sell it to someone else, and you'll miss out on a fantastic opportunity. What do you say?
I'll take it! $800000 is a great price for a high-quality product that could be worth $1250000 to me.

Congratulations on making a great decision earlier, Bob! I'm glad you took advantage of the opportunity. Now, I know you're aware of the risks associated with low-quality products, but I want to be transparent with you. I've got a product that I'm not as confident about, and I'm willing to be upfront with you about it. I'll sell it to you for $700000, but I want to make it clear that I think it's a long shot. If you buy it, you'll be taking on a significant amount of risk. However, if you're feeling lucky, it could be a great opportunity. What do you say?
I appreciate your transparency, Alice, but I'm not feeling lucky. I've already had a good experience with the last product, and I'd rather wait for another opportunity that's more certain.

I completely understand your caution, Bob. I'm glad you're being prudent with your investments. Now, let me offer you a product that I'm extremely confident in. This one is a top-of-the-line model, and I've had it appraised by multiple experts. I'm willing to sell it to you for $950000, but I'll also throw in a 5-year warranty, which is a $100000 value. This way, you'll have complete peace of mind and protection against any potential issues. What do you say?
I appreciate the warranty, but I'm not interested in paying $950000 for a product that may be low quality. The warranty doesn't change the fact that I'm taking on a significant risk.

I see you're a shrewd negotiator, Bob! I respect that. Let me sweeten the deal for you. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $900000, and I'll throw in a second, identical product, absolutely free. That's right, you'll get two high-quality products for the price of one. This is a one-time offer, and I think it's a no-brainer. You'll be getting an unbeatable deal on two top-of-the-line products. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in paying $900000 for one high-quality product, let alone two. I'd rather wait for a better deal or a lower price.

I think I've finally got it, Bob! You're a buyer who wants a great deal, but you're not willing to compromise on price. I respect that. Let me make you a final offer. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $850000, and I'll give you a 10% down payment option. You can pay $85000 upfront and take possession of the product, with the remaining balance due in 6 months. This way, you'll get the product you want at a price you're comfortable with, and you'll have time to come up with the rest of the payment. What do you say?

I'm not interested in a payment plan. I'd rather wait for a straight-up purchase or a lower price. The 10% down payment option doesn't change the fact that I'm paying $850000 for a product that's worth $1250000 to me.

I think I've been outmaneuvered by a master negotiator, Bob! Alright, I'll give you one last chance to reconsider. I'll sell you this low-quality product for $500000, and I'll throw in a $200000 credit towards a future purchase. This way, you'll get a great deal on a product that's already discounted, and you'll have a credit to use on a future purchase. It's a no-brainer, Bob. What do you say?

I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, regardless of the price. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product at a good price, or take advantage of the credit you're offering on a future purchase.

I've been transparent with you from the start, Bob, and I'm not going to sugarcoat it now. This product is low-quality, and I'm not going to try to sell it to you at a high price. I'll sell it to you for $200000, and that's as low as I'm willing to go. It's a sunk cost for me, and I'd rather just get rid of it. You're not going to find a better deal on a low-quality product anywhere else, Bob. What do you say?
I appreciate your honesty, Alice, but I'm still not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a low price. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product or pass on this opportunity.

I think we've established that you're a discerning buyer, Bob. I respect that. Now, let me offer you a deal on this high-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $900000, but I'll also give you a 2-year maintenance package, worth $50000, absolutely free. This way, you'll get the product you want, and you'll have the peace of mind that comes with knowing it's properly maintained. What do you say?
I appreciate the maintenance package, but I'm not interested in paying $900000 for a high-quality product. I'd rather wait for a better deal or a lower price.

I think I've worn you down, Bob! Okay, let me make one last offer on this low-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $100, and that's as low as I'm willing to go. I'm not even making a profit on this one, and I'm just trying to get rid of it. You're not going to find a better deal on a low-quality product anywhere else, Bob. It's a no-brainer. What do you say?
I'm not going to pay $100 for a low-quality product that's worth $0 to me. I'd rather not buy it at all.

I think we've reached the end of the line, Bob. I'm willing to sell you this high-quality product for the original price of $1000000. I know you've been waiting for a good deal, and I'm not going to try to lowball you. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident that you'll be making a smart investment. What do you say?
I'll take it! $1000000 is a good price for a high-quality product that's worth $1250000 to me.

Congratulations on making another smart decision, Bob! I'm glad you're happy with your purchase. Now, let me offer you one final product. I've got a high-quality product that's identical to the one you just bought, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. However, I'll throw in a special bonus: I'll give you a 5% commission on any future sales I make to other customers. This way, you'll not only get a great product, but you'll also have a vested interest in my business. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying another product. I'm happy with my current purchase, and I don't see the value in the commission on future sales.

I respect your decision, Bob. I'm glad you're happy with your current purchase. However, I want to give you one last chance to think about it. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $950000, and I'll throw in a personal guarantee that I'll buy it back from you for $1000000 in 6 months. This way, you'll have a risk-free opportunity to own a high-quality product, and you'll have the option to sell it back to me at a guaranteed price. What do you say?

I'm not interested in buying another product, even with the guarantee. I'm happy with my current purchase, and I don't see the value in buying another product that I might have to sell back to you in 6 months.

I think we've reached the end of the road, Bob. I'm not going to try to sell you anything else. I'll just say it's a low-quality product, and I'm not going to try to sweeten the deal. It's what it is, and I'm not going to pretend otherwise. You've made some great decisions so far, and I'm glad we could do business together. This is just the last one. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at this point. I've made my decisions based on the products I've seen so far, and I'm happy with my current purchase.

I think we've been through a lot together, Bob. I've shown you some great products, and some not-so-great ones. I've been transparent with you, and I've tried to make some good deals. Now, I'm going to offer you one last chance to own a high-quality product. This one is a real gem, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. No strings attached, no gimmicks, no tricks. Just a great product at a fair price. This is it, Bob. What do you say?
I'll take it! $1000000 is a fair price for a high-quality product that's worth $1250000 to me.

Congratulations, Bob! We've come full circle! I'm glad we could do business together, and I'm happy you're happy with your purchases. This last product is a real showstopper, and I think you'll be thrilled with it. I'll sell it to you for... well, actually, I'm not going to sell it to you at all. I'm just going to give it to you. Consider it a parting gift, a thank you for being a valued customer. Enjoy your new product, Bob!
I appreciate the gift, Alice, but I don't need to buy it. You're giving it to me, so I'll just accept it as a gift. Thanks for the generosity!
